title: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is being marked as dirtied even though no changes have been made. Additionally, code assist does not appear.
OB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is being marked as dirtied even though no changes have been made. Additionally, code assist does not appear.
EB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file should not be marked as dirtied if no changes have been made. Code assist should also appear as expected.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press Ctrl+Space to trigger code assist.
